comments:
The Debug and Ant performance tests need to be backported for the 2.1.3, 3.0 
and 3.0.1 builds.

Instructions:

To compile in your workspace, please use these versions of the 
org.eclipse.test.performance plug-in, 

v20041021_perf213 
v20041021_perf30 
v20041021_perf301 

for eclipse 2.1.3, 3.0 and 3.0.1 respectively. 

Please remember to also add a "performance" target to your test.xml script. 

Once the tests are backported please release to these branches of the 
org.eclipse.releng project, 

perf_213 
perf_30 
perf_301 

for eclipse 2.1.3, 3.0 and 3.0.1 respectively.

I have backported the tests for 3.0 3.0.1 and 2.1*
For 3.0.1 and 2.1 the backports have been released to the perspective 
maintanance branches.
For 3.0 the backport has been released to perf_30 branch.

Good to go for Ant and debug in 3.0, 3.0.1. Versioned and maps updated.

Remaining issue: the debug backport to 2.1.* is failing to suspend for the 
stepping performance test. Note I moved to using 3.1 to host a 2.1.3 dev by 
setting the target platform in the pde perferences.

The stepping test has been disabled for 2.1.* tests and plugin has been 
released to the releng perf_213 branch.

I have also modified all the tests to have longer duration as per the recent 
platform-releng email from Andre.

See what happens on Friday :-)

Apparently, our 2.1.3 backport is failing:

Program did not suspend, launch terminated. 

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Program did not suspend, launch 
terminated.
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.AbstractDebugTest.launchAndWait

(AbstractDebugTest.java:268)

ditionalBreakpoint(PerfConditionalBreakpointsTests.java:43)

The tests failed in the weekly build, but I was unable to reproduce the 
failure.

I have backported the current performance tests to 2.1.3. We should update the 
2.1.3 stream weeklty, with the 3.0/3.0.1 streams.
